str2: Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To despise, scorn, and show it by active insult, disregard. From kata and phroneo; to think against, i.e. Disesteem.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of pletho; wealth, i.e. money, possessions, or abundance, richness, valuable bestowment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Goodness, uprightness, kindness, gentleness. From chrestos; usefulness, i.e. Morally, excellence.
Forbearance, suspense or delay (of punishment), patience. From anechomai; self-restraint, i.e. Tolerance.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Useful, gentle, pleasant, kind. From chraomai; employed, i.e. useful.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
